stem.paragraph_1: Which clinical vignette best fits the following blood smear?

options: 24 year-old female with fatigue and menorrhagia.
75 year-old man with recurrent falls and glossitis.
57 year-old female with a family history of anemia.

stem.paragraph_1: Which clinical vignette best fits the following blood smear?

options: 47 year-old female with a history of gastric bypass surgery and complaints of tingling and numbness affecting her fingers and toes.
73 year-old man with a history of abdominal pain and copious ibuprofen use, now with tarry black stools.
An 8 year-old boy, originally from Nigeria, with severe chest pain, tachycardia, and inspiratory lung crackles in the posterior lung fields.

stem.paragraph_1: Which clinical vignette best fits the following blood smear?

options: 30 year-old woman with gallstones and jaundice, and a family history of a cousin who underwent splenectomy at a young age.
57 year-old African-American man with jaundice after taking trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole for a urinary tract infection.
